topics: Node.js as an API (PUT POST DELETE)
Introduction to AJAX and Basic Web Security

grading.policies: You MUST have an average of at LEAST 70% to pass the course.

assignments.description: Lab assignments should be handed in on time. Multiple file assignments should be submitted in an archive with a readme file.
Final project includes a web application with multiple backend and frontend components, proposal, database proposal, and presentation.

policies.late_work: Late assignments will receive a 15-point penalty PER DAY that it is late. Final project components will receive a 25-point penalty PER DAY.
policies.academic_integrity: ZERO tolerance policy for sharing code and cheating. Plagiarism will result in a 0 for the lab or project.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: WS Online students must have a working webcam and compatible computer for the final exam.

_metadata.course_description: This course will provide students with a first strong approach of internet programming.
learning_outcomes: Install and configure a web programming environment.
Write programs in the chosen programming language.
Use a modern database to create database-driven applications.
Create HTML pages and use basic JavaScript.
Identify major vulnerabilities in web development.
Create a complete market-ready database-driven web application.
prerequisites: Undergraduate: CS 182 - Introduction to Comp Sci-Honors II or CS 385 - Algorithms
